name: Sierra Oncology, Inc.
description: Sierra Oncology, Inc. is a biotechnology company focused on developing and commercializing innovative therapeutics for patients with serious unmet medical needs, primarily in the field of oncology. Founded in 2003, the company has concentrated its efforts on creating targeted therapies aimed at treating cancer. Sierra's lead product candidate, Sierra Oncology, is designed to treat patients with specific types of blood cancers and solid tumors. The company's research emphasizes the development of drugs that can enhance the effectiveness of existing therapies while minimizing side effects. Sierra Oncology aims to improve patient outcomes through precision medicine, utilizing advanced genomic technologies to tailor treatments based on individual patient profiles. The company is committed to advancing its pipeline of clinical-stage assets, fostering partnerships with other biotech firms and research institutions to facilitate innovation. Through its dedicated team of scientists and clinical researchers, Sierra Oncology strives to bring forth transformative therapies that address the complexities of cancer treatment, ultimately improving the quality of life for patients and their families.

key_executives.name: David M. C. C. G. Tso

seo.meta_title: Sierra Oncology, Inc. | Innovative Cancer Therapeutics
seo.meta_description: Explore Sierra Oncology, Inc., a biotech company dedicated to developing targeted therapies for cancer treatment. Learn about our innovative approach to oncology.

faq.question: What is Sierra Oncology known for?
faq.answer: Sierra Oncology is known for developing innovative cancer therapeutics aimed at improving patient outcomes.

faq.question: Who is the CEO of Sierra Oncology?
faq.answer: Stephen Dilly is the CEO of Sierra Oncology, Inc.

faq.question: Where is Sierra Oncology headquartered?
faq.answer: Sierra Oncology is headquartered in San Mateo, California, USA.

faq.question: What are Sierra Oncology's main products?
faq.answer: Sierra Oncology's main product candidate is focused on treating specific blood cancers and solid tumors.
